com.googlecode.streamflyer.core
Interface Modifier

All Known Implementing Classes:
InvalidXmlCharacterModifier, RangeFilterModifier, RegexModifier, StatefulModifier, XmlVersionModifier, XmlVersionModifier
public interface Modifier

A modifier replaces, deletes, inserts characters in a character stream. This happens in interaction with a stream processor, i. e. either a ModifyingReader or a ModifyingWriter. The modifier can be considered a callback that is called by the stream processor to make the desired modifications. The pivotal part of the interaction between the modifier and the stream processor is a character buffer the stream processor facilitates. That buffer contains the characters of the underlying character stream.

Besides the modifications of the buffer, the modifier manages the capacity (size) of the character buffer and defines what the stream processor shall do before the stream processor calls the modifier the next time.

Implementations of this interface should inform the user about its specific memory consumption because the most important feature of modifiers should be their small memory foot-print.

Since:
06.05.2011
Author:
rwoo

Method Summary
 AfterModification modify(StringBuilder characterBuffer, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer, boolean endOfStreamHit)
          Processes the characters in the given character buffer, i.e. deletes or replaces or inserts characters, or keeps the characters as they are.
 

Method Detail

modify

AfterModification modify(StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                         int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                         boolean endOfStreamHit)
Processes the characters in the given character buffer, i.e. deletes or replaces or inserts characters, or keeps the characters as they are.

Parameters:
characterBuffer - The next characters provided from the modifiable stream. It contains the modifiable characters, (optionally) preceded by unmodifiable characters.

The modifier can modify the content of the buffer as appropriate the modifier must not modify the unmodifiable characters, i.e. the characters before position firstModifiableCharacterInBufferIndex must not be modified.

Your modifier should manage the capacity of the buffer on its own - as the optimal management of the capacity depends on the specific purpose of the modifier.

The given buffer must be never null.

firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer - index of the first modifiable character in the buffer. The index of the first character in the buffer is zero. If there is not modifiable character in the buffer, then this value is equal the length of the buffer.
endOfStreamHit - True if no more characters can be read from the stream, i.e. the character buffer contains the all the characters up to the end of the stream.
Returns:
Returns an object that defines how ModifyingReader or ModifyingWriter shall behave before calling modify(StringBuilder, int, boolean) again.
